items.title: Uganda v Nigeria: Africa Cup of Nations 2025 ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Afcon updates from the 4pm kick-off (GMT) in Group D ‚öΩ Live scores | Follow us on Bluesky | And email Michael That is a surprising XI from Nigeria! Not only because of who they have rested, but also who they have included. Only Bassey, Onyemaechi and Osimhen retain their place here from the XI that started against Tunisia. Captain Wilfred Ndidi, Semi Ajayi and goalkeeper Stanley Nwabali are all rested given the threat of suspension. The trio all received yellow cards in the group stage and another here would mean a suspension for the knockouts, so it‚Äôs smart to rest them. That makes the inclusion of superstar striker Osimhen all the more baffling, given he is also in the same boat. √âric Chelle will be praying the Galatasaray forward does not pick up another yellow here, or he will miss the last-16 match. Continue reading...

items.title: Semenyo‚Äôs move to Manchester City nears as Bournemouth hammer out terms
items.summary: Move could be completed as soon as New Year‚Äôs Day City could let Oscar Bobb or Savinho leave Bournemouth expect Antoine Semenyo‚Äôs transfer to Manchester City to be finalised this week, with the only remaining issue being the payment terms of his release clause. The wide forward‚Äôs clause is worth slightly less than ¬£65m, a sum that includes loyalty money and agent fees. City are thought to want to pay this over three years and Bournemouth believe an agreement will be sealed by Sunday at the latest but possibly as soon as New Year‚Äôs Day. Continue reading...

items.title: Amrabat staat pal achter Marokko-bondscoach: 'Kritiek hoort erbij, fluiten niet'
items.summary: Sofyan Amrabat heeft zich uitgesproken over de kritiek die Marokko-bondscoach Walid Regragui in aanloop naar het Afrika Cup-duel met Zambia heeft ontvangen. De middenvelder staat pal achter Regragui, die voor de aftrap werd uitgefloten door een aantal fans . Dat is niet de manier, vindt Amrabat.

items.title: Terence Kongolo naar beloften verbannen bij NAC
items.summary: De rol van Terence Kongolo bij NAC Breda lijkt definitief uitgespeeld. De viervoudig Oranje-international is naar de beloften verwezen.

items.title: Zola ziet H√∏jlund opbloeien bij Napoli en uit kritiek op Ten Hag
items.summary: Gianfranco Zola is onder de indruk van Scott McTominay en Rasmus H√∏jlund. Beiden werden voor hun transfer naar Napoli als overbodig bestempeld bij Manchester United, maar hebben The Red Devils inmiddels flink achter de oren laten krabben. Met name McTominay heeft zich ontpopt tot een superster in Napels. Volgens Zola ligt de schuld vooral bij Erik Ten Hag.

items.title: Hakimi returns as Morocco seal AFCON knockouts
items.summary: Africa Cup of Nations hosts Morocco dispatched Zambia 3-0 at a fervid Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat on Monday to round off their Group A campaign in style and ease into the round of 16.

items.title: Crystal Palace agree ¬£35m fee for Brennan Johnson as race for Spurs forward hots up
items.summary: Figure would be a club-record transfer for Palace Johnson yet to decide with Bournemouth also interested Crystal Palace have agreed a club-record ¬£35m fee with Tottenham for Brennan Johnson but are facing strong competition from Bournemouth to sign the Wales forward. Palace are desperate for reinforcements in attack after a punishing schedule that has seen them play 30 games in all competitions this season because of their Conference League commitments. With Senegal forward Isma√Øla Sarr away at the African Cup of Nations, the club identified Johnson as their primary target for the January window and opened talks with Tottenham several weeks ago. Continue reading...

items.title: Johnson to decide future after Palace deal agreed
items.summary: Brennan Johnson is set to decide whether he wants to join Crystal Palace after the south London club agreed a ¬£35m deal to sign the Tottenham attacker.

items.title: What will women‚Äôs football in England look like in 10 years‚Äô time?
items.summary: With the club game hurtling along a Premier League-trodden path, women‚Äôs football is at a crossroads Where will women‚Äôs football in England be in a decade‚Äôs time? How can we possibly begin to imagine the scale of the interest, attendances and participation then? How will the game on the pitch have developed, with each generation of players training and playing in better and better environments and at younger ages? In truth, it‚Äôs near impossible to make even educated guesses. Women‚Äôs football in England is at a crossroads. The Women‚Äôs Super League and Women‚Äôs Super League 2 are now run independently of the Football Association, leading to increased outside investment, the rise of multi-club ownership groups, and the million-pound transfer barrier being broken twice in one summer. Minimum standards in the WSL and WSL2 have also been extended or raised, and while there is always talk of maintaining the connection between players and supporters, the women‚Äôs game is hurtling along a Premier League-trodden path at a fierce pace. Continue reading...

items.summary: Champions have conceded 12 set-piece goals in league Arne Slot expressed his dismay before Wolves game Liverpool have parted company with their first-team set-piece coach, Aaron Briggs, in response to the weaknesses that have blighted Arne Slot‚Äôs side this season. Slot has made no secret of his dismay with Liverpool‚Äôs set-piece failings at both ends of the pitch, and admitted they were holding back the Premier League champions before Saturday‚Äôs 2-1 win over Wolves. items.title: Liverpool set-piece coach leaves club amid woeful record this season
items.summary: Liverpool set-piece coach Aaron Briggs has left the club midway through a season in which the Reds have the joint-worst set-play record in Europe's big five leagues.
